text: I take measures to reduce my carbon footprint.
I take measures to act in an environmentally friendly way.
I strive to behave sustainably.
I engage in discussions about the environment .
I engage with the climate movement by reading articles, watching videos and seeking knowledge on the topic.

I take measures to reduce my fuel consumption (e.g. when travelling, I opt for car pools, cycling, public transport and walking when possible. If I use my car, I will reduce excessive fuel consumption by restricting use of radio and airconditioning).

I take appropriate measures to reduce energy consumption (by using energy saving light bulbs, turning lights off when leaving the room unattended, turning off electronic devices when unused, reducing use of airconditioning and fans, using energy efficient appliances etc.).

I take appropriate measures to reduce energy consumption for heating (e.g. by keeping indoor temperature low, washing clothes at a lower temperature, wearing more clothes rather than using the heating, turning off heating in empty rooms etc.).
I have installed or am seriously considering installing solar panels for electricity, solar water heating and/or buying my household electricity on a Green Tariff.
I take as few flights as possible, and offset those which I do take.

I reduce the amount of water I use (e.g. shorter showers, not running tap water unnecessarily during toothbrushing & dishwashing, lowering frequency of dishwaster usage and toilet flushing, waiting for a full load before washing dishes and clothes, collecting rainwater, reducing or avoiding using sprinklers in the garden, using water stations for hydration rather than purchasing bottled water).
I decide not to buy something becuase I think it has too much packaging or that its packaging is non-eco friendly/biodegradable.
I buy package free items (including cosmetics, toiletries, using refill stations, produce).
I buy products made of recycled materials.
I buy products made of sustainable, natural or biodegradable materials.
I recycle as much as I possibly can (newspapers, cans, plastics and glass).
I compost household food waste (my green kitchen waste is composted in the garden or at a municipal facility).
I reuse household waste items that would otherwise go in the bin (e.g. jars, bottles, gift wrap).
I purchase second-hand goods.
I buy and reuse items which have multiple uses (bags for life, reuasable coffee cup/water bottle) and avoid single use items (such as disposable coffee cups, plastic bags, plastic water bottles).
I buy environmentally friendly alternatives to toxic products (e.g natural deoderant, organic produce) or avoid the chemical product altogether (e.g hairspray/growing own produce).
I eat food which is locally or home grown/farmed.
I eat food which is in season.
I actively look for recycling bins to dispose of recyclable items, including when I am out of my house and in public areas.
I take initiative to find sustainable ways to dispose of your not-locally recycled waste (e.g. terracycling, products that would usually be rubbish).
I buy fairtrade and/or sustainably sourced food.
I donate clothes and furniture to charity.
I reduce my food waste (donate food to charities, avoid buying too much food, home freezing etc.).
I limit or reduce my consumption of animal products (dairy, poultry, fish etc.).
I eat sustainably sourced animal products (dairy, poultry, fish etc.).
I buy organic produce (e.g. food, toiletries, cosmetics).
I buy goods and products from local or independent businesses rather than large corperations.
